pull_request.title: Fix OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD logic for Frodo
pull_request.body:
The Frodo code currently ignores OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD if it is compiled on a machine without AVX2 instructions.

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/5b2ed97f08ba94c59ea2769b5e52760accc51f44/src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo_macrify_optimized.c#L27-L40

My understanding of OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD is that a less powerful machine should be able to compile a library that takes advantage of the features of a more powerful machine (without fixing the target machine at compile time). This PR brings the Frodo code in line with my expectations.

There are other places where the OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD logic could be improved. E.g we ignore OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD in alg_support.cmake while setting the value of the "OQS_ENABLE_X" variables. I'll open separate issues or PRs for those.

pull_request.title: interop server test script added [skip ci]
pull_request.body:
Without parameters, this script executes tests against all algorithms exposed at https://test.openquantumsafe.org outputting all KEM algorithms tested. On error, testing stops.

With any parameter, this script executes tests against all algorithms exposed at https://test.openquantumsafe.org only outputting the SIG algorithms tested. On error, testing continues, outputting test command and error.

pull_request.title: guard Frodo AVX2 code if CPU_EXTENSIONS not requested
pull_request.body:
#927 breaks builds when [OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Customizing-liboqs#oqs_use_cpu_extensions): See e.g. [here](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/338/workflows/84da16f9-8f90-446e-b371-25d7e6d88258/jobs/413). This PR is one way to fix it. Another alternative is to not set `OQS_PORTABLE_X86_64_BUILD` if `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF`: Any preference, @jschanck ?

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)
